refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Unicode functions are used to access Unicode character properties. With these functions, client programs can query various properties from the Unicode Character Database for any code point, such as General Category (gc), Script (sc), Canonical Combining Class (ccc), etc.
Client programs can optionally pass in their own Unicode functions that implement the same queries. The set of functions available is defined by the virtual methods in hb_unicode_funcs_t.
HarfBuzz provides built-in default functions for each method in hb_unicode_funcs_t.

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_general_category ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the General Category (gc) property of code point unicode .
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_combining_class ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the Canonical Combining Class (ccc) property of code point unicode .
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_mirroring ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the Bi-directional Mirroring Glyph code point defined for code point unicode .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The hb_codepoint_t of the Mirroring Glyph for unicode

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_script ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the hb_script_t script to which code point unicode belongs.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_compose ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_unicode_compose (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_codepoint_t a, hb_codepoint_t b, hb_codepoint_t *ab);
refsect2.para: Fetches the composition of a sequence of two Unicode code points.
Calls the composition function of the specified Unicode-functions structure ufuncs .

entry.para: The first Unicode code point to compose
The second Unicode code point to compose

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if a and b composed, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_decompose ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_unicode_decompose (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_codepoint_t ab, hb_codepoint_t *a, hb_codepoint_t *b);
refsect2.para: Fetches the decomposition of a Unicode code point.
Calls the decomposition function of the specified Unicode-functions structure ufuncs .

entry.para: The first code point of the decomposition of ab .
The second code point of the decomposition of ab .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if ab was decomposed, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_create ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new hb_unicode_funcs_t structure of Unicode functions.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_get_empty ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the singleton empty Unicode-functions structure.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_reference ()
refsect2.para: Increases the reference count on a Unicode-functions structure.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Decreases the reference count on a Unicode-functions structure. When the reference count reaches zero, the Unicode-functions structure is destroyed, freeing all memory.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_user_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_unicode_funcs_set_user_data (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_user_data_key_t *key, void *data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy, hb_bool_t replace);
refsect2.para: Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the specified Unicode-functions structure.

entry.para: A pointer to the user data
A callback to call when data is not needed anymore.
Whether to replace an existing data with the same key

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_get_user_data ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the user-data associated with the specified key, attached to the specified Unicode-functions structure.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A pointer to the user data.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_make_immutable ()
refsect2.para: Makes the specified Unicode-functions structure immutable.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_is_immutable ()
refsect2.para: Tests whether the specified Unicode-functions structure is immutable.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if ufuncs is immutable, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Fetches a pointer to the default Unicode-functions structure that is used when no functions are explicitly set on hb_buffer_t.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a pointer to the hb_unicode_funcs_t Unicode-functions structure.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_get_parent ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the parent of the Unicode-functions structure ufuncs .
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_general_category_func_t ()
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.
This method should retrieve the General Category property for a specified Unicode code point.

entry.para: User data pointer passed by the caller

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_general_category_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_general_category_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_general_category_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_general_category_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_combining_class_func_t ()
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.
This method should retrieve the Canonical Combining Class (ccc) property for a specified Unicode code point.

entry.para: User data pointer passed by the caller

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_combining_class_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_combining_class_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_combining_class_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_combining_class_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_mirroring_func_t ()
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.
This method should retrieve the Bi-Directional Mirroring Glyph code point for a specified Unicode code point.
refsect2.note: Note: If a code point does not have a specified Bi-Directional Mirroring Glyph defined, the method should return the original code point.

entry.para: User data pointer passed by the caller

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The hb_codepoint_t of the Mirroring Glyph for unicode

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_mirroring_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_mirroring_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_mirroring_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_mirroring_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_script_func_t ()
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.
This method should retrieve the Script property for a specified Unicode code point.

entry.para: User data pointer passed by the caller

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_script_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_script_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_script_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_script_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_compose_func_t ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t (*hb_unicode_compose_func_t) (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_codepoint_t a, hb_codepoint_t b, hb_codepoint_t *ab, void *user_data);
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.

This method should compose a sequence of two input Unicode code points by canonical equivalence, returning the composed code point in a hb_codepoint_t output parameter (if successful). The method must return an hb_bool_t indicating the success of the composition.

entry.para: The first code point to compose
The second code point to compose
user data pointer passed by the caller

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true is a ,b composed, false otherwise

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_compose_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_compose_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_compose_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_compose_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_decompose_func_t ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t (*hb_unicode_decompose_func_t) (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_codepoint_t ab, hb_codepoint_t *a, hb_codepoint_t *b, void *user_data);
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_unicode_funcs_t structure.

This method should decompose an input Unicode code point, returning the two decomposed code points in hb_codepoint_t output parameters (if successful). The method must return an hb_bool_t indicating the success of the composition.

entry.para: user data pointer passed by the caller

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if ab decomposed, false otherwise

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_set_decompose_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_unicode_funcs_set_decompose_func (hb_unicode_funcs_t *ufuncs, hb_unicode_decompose_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation function for hb_unicode_decompose_func_t.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: HB_UNICODE_MAX
refsect2.para: Maximum valid Unicode code point.
Since: 1.9.0

refsect2.title: enum hb_unicode_combining_class_t
refsect2.para: Data type for the Canonical_Combining_Class (ccc) property from the Unicode Character Database.
refsect2.note: Note: newer versions of Unicode may add new values. Client programs should be ready to handle any value in the 0..254 range being returned from hb_unicode_combining_class().

entry.para: Spacing and enclosing marks; also many vowel and consonant signs, even if nonspacing
Marks which overlay a base letter or symbol
Diacritic nukta marks in Brahmi-derived scripts
Marks attached at the bottom left
Marks attached at the top right
Distinct marks at the bottom left
Distinct marks at the bottom right
Distinct marks at the top left
Distinct marks at the top right
Distinct marks extending above two bases

refsect2.title: enum hb_unicode_general_category_t
refsect2.para: Data type for the "General_Category" (gc) property from the Unicode Character Database.

refsect2.title: hb_unicode_funcs_t
refsect2.para: Data type containing a set of virtual methods used for accessing various Unicode character properties.

HarfBuzz provides a default function for each of the methods in hb_unicode_funcs_t. Client programs can implement their own replacements for the individual Unicode functions, as needed, and replace the default by calling the setter for a method.
